subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: New to the board
author: juli velazquez
full_text:
--0-1010186268-1204566816=:51603
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Ann:
              Skype is free for your computer.  You just need to download it at skype.com.  Many of us are on there and can be found under our names (my is ghostchasingfool).  Once you add the people you are looking for to your contact list you are pretty much ready to go.  You can buzz us or send messages.  You can have up to 9 people at a time to actually speak across the country and listen to the various sessions.  It seems as of late, we have no set time, but just happen to yell at someone, and who is ever on we ask if they would like to participate and listen to the various boxes.  My friend Ray Jordon of UK5 Paranormal joinning last weekend and was amazed at Frank's Box and the RS Hacks.  It affords an opportunity to get the word out, and share our theories across the world even.
   
                The best is its free!
   
    Juli
   
              
   
   
   
  

Lisby <lisby@...> wrote:
          Juli--how does a skype session work?  

  Ann
  
    On Mar 3, 2008, at 10:23 AM, juli velazquez wrote:

          

  I am extremely greatful to have gotten a box and I'm more than happy to share the audio as well as doing sessions with anyone if they would like to experience one of Frank's wonderful devises.  Some of the previous owners of the boxes don't seem willing to share, or feel a need to charge you for the experience.  I think this is a terrible!!!  Frank had spent many hours building this devices, and believe this was never his intention for people to keep their experience and audio to themselves or to profit in anyway.
   
  Therefore, anyone wanting to sit in on a session is more than welcome.  Some of us here get together via Skype free internet phone, allowing an opportunity for anyone to take part and share the experience.  Just because you don't have  FB doesn't mean you can't experience and take part in great communication.  Prior to me owning one, I sat in with Steve and Bruce, allowing me an opportunity to listen to their FB's (which they both have differently unique boxes) and do my own recordings.  To them I was very greatful, and I never felt left off. 
   
  Many of us have various boxes and conduct sessions differently, this allows us additional ways to learn from each other and experience all the boxes. 
   
  If anyone is interested, please just let me know, some of you hear already can confirm these get togethers and you walk away with a greater respect for each other and spirit communication.
   
  Juli
   
  

purplespacefriend <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
      Yep!

FS
--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Joanne Tauferner <tauf03@...> wrote:
>
> I believe it was Rosemary who was on C2C in December who stated she 
had two of your boxes. One of them was 22 and the other was 21 or 
23. I can't remember which other one but they are consecutive 
numbers.
> 
> Joanne :^)
> 
> purplespacefriend <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
> If anyone would care to go to my site that I set up to 
share 
> information(http://purplealiengirl.tripod.com/), they will hear how 
my 
> contacts swear I am their long lost Purple Princess. It would be 
> difficult for me to biased against women since I am one on the 
inside, 
> even "normal" ghosts claim they see a woman. While a straight, 
albeit 
> old, male, I prefer the feminine side of things. Purple is not so 
much 
> a type of alien, or Planet. It's a spiritual designation, as in the 
> Purple Lady, or someone on a spiritual mission. I don't understand 
it 
> completely either, but it's connected to the Catholics some how. I 
> don't want to get caught up in religious dogma. 
> 
> The people with boxes were supposed to be testing them, not going 
off 
> on ego trips, and claiming to be great mediums which was somehow 
> bestowed on them by box use. There is one guy that got four, and 
> claimed none worked, so that's four out of circulation. Yeah, I am 
a 
> bit on the gullible side. There some I can't account for, like #21, 
I 
> have no idea where it is, or if I skipped a number. A woman in San 
> Diego did get a box directly from me last year, but somehow, Moon 
ended 
> up with it. After last year, of almost non-stop box building, I 
just 
> reached a point where I dread making them for people anymore.
> 
> Rosemary Guiley has one, Robin ( a local researcher's wife) got one 
in 
> December for thier wedding. Woman in San Diego had one. There are 
women 
> that are deserving of boxes, and who have waited the longest, but I 
> dread giving anymore because it creates more demand. 
> 
> It's just a raido for crying out loud!
> 
> Frank-S
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
